posts.name: Espino
posts.cooked:
Hi, i need help to cut the tread for the 4in Aluminum Wheels from WCP. I do not have the tool and I would like to make it, but I do not know the distance of the 3/16 holes. Do you have the plane or a cad to do it?

53.55 KB

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked:
Armabot has you covered:

Quickly make perfect tread segments for the West Coast Products 4 inch aluminum wheel.  This tool is made from steel with 8 positions for drilling the fastening holes and a properly designed channel to cut off tread at the correct length. ...

Price: USD 59.00

posts.name: Espino

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked: yea… using the 3.25 inch wheels without the tread jig that’s still on backorder has been an interesting time. We’ve basically tried our best to create our own jig… and since WCP doesn’t provide the wheel hole spacing on any drawing I’ve seen it’s been a real adventure.

posts.name: Nate Laverdure (he/him)
posts.cooked: I wonder if the Right to Repair bill that California was considering in 2021 would apply in this case.
